Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2009 11:09PM MaeTucson wrote: There is a great song by Joe Jackson called Cancer.  Everything gives you cancer Everything gives you cancer There's no cure, there's no answer Everything gives you cancer Don't touch that dial Don't try to smile Just take this pill It's in your file Don't work hard Don't play hard Don't plan for the graveyard Remember - Everything gives you cancer There's no cure, there's no answer Everything gives you cancer Don't work by night Don't sleep by day You'll feel all right But you will pay No caffeine No protein No booze or Nicotine Remember - I know there are many people who become strong, who work out, there are boot camps, people run, they change their lives.  And I respect that.  For me?  I am going to live my life without apology.  If I want a martini, I have one.  For a while here I was smoking.  Shameful!  But it was what I needed to do to cope at that time, and I will not beat myself up for it.  I refuse to believe that my cancer is my fault.  Cancer is the fault of the universe, it is something that happens.  It is like a lightening strike.  I will fight it, I will not let it defeat me.  And I will not let it define me or make me stop living.  I plan to live right up until I die.
